channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: U.S. House rejects aviation safety bill after Pentagon abruptly withdraws support
item.description: The House of Representatives narrowly rejected a bipartisan aviation safety bill that was spurred by the deadly midair collision near Washington, D.C., after the Pentagon abruptly withdrew support.
item.content:encoded:
The House of Representatives narrowly rejected a bipartisan aviation safety bill that was spurred by the deadly midair collision near Washington, D.C., after the Pentagon abruptly withdrew support.

(Image credit: Mariam Zuhaib)
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose

item.title: Will American shoppers get a tariff refund?
item.description: Americans paid for tariffs. They shouldn't expect their money back.
item.content:encoded: Americans paid for tariffs. They shouldn't expect their money back.
item.dc:creator: Stephan Bisaha

item.title: Savannah Guthrie offers $1 million reward for information about missing mother Nancy
item.description: In an emotional video plea, Savannah Guthrie announced a $1 million family reward for her mother, Nancy's, recovery.
item.content:encoded: In an emotional video plea, Savannah Guthrie announced a $1 million family reward for her mother, Nancy's, recovery.
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Hegseth threatens to blacklist Anthropic over 'woke AI' concerns
item.description: The company's Claude chatbot is one of the few AI systems cleared for use in classified settings. But a standoff between Anthropic and the Trump administration is putting its government work at risk.
item.content:encoded:
The company's Claude chatbot is one of the few AI systems cleared for use in classified settings. But a standoff between Anthropic and the Trump administration is putting its government work at risk.

(Image credit: STAFF)
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: Listen to NPR live coverage of the State of the Union
item.description: President Trump will address the nation Tuesday night to outline his vision and priorities for his administration's second year. Listen to NPR's live special coverage of the speech and the Democratic response.
item.content:encoded: President Trump will address the nation Tuesday night to outline his vision and priorities for his administration's second year. Listen to NPR's live special coverage of the speech and the Democratic response.
item.dc:creator: Heidi Glenn

item.title: DOJ hides Trump-related Epstein files. And, what to know for the State of the Union
item.description: An NPR investigation found that the DOJ withheld some Epstein files related to abuse allegations against Trump. And, what you need to know ahead of the president's State of the Union address tonight.
item.content:encoded:
An NPR investigation found that the DOJ withheld some Epstein files related to abuse allegations against Trump. And, what you need to know ahead of the president's State of the Union address tonight.

(Image credit: Brendan Smialowski)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Voters share their thoughts on the state of the union ahead of Trump's address
item.description: Ahead of the State of the Union address, voters describe how they view the economy, immigration and the country's direction.
item.content:encoded: Ahead of the State of the Union address, voters describe how they view the economy, immigration and the country's direction.
item.dc:creator: Hosts

item.title: 'Fear of Flying Clinic' helps anxious travelers back into the skies
item.description: For 50 years, a San Francisco-based group has created a space where fearful flyers can get supported exposure to air travel.
item.content:encoded:
For 50 years, a San Francisco-based group has created a space where fearful flyers can get supported exposure to air travel.

(Image credit: Evan Roberts)
item.dc:creator: Evan Roberts

item.title: Justice Department withheld and removed some Epstein files related to Trump
item.description: An NPR investigation finds the public database of Epstein files is missing dozens of pages related to sexual abuse accusations against President Trump.
item.content:encoded:
An NPR investigation finds the public database of Epstein files is missing dozens of pages related to sexual abuse accusations against President Trump.

(Image credit: Department of Justice and Getty Images/Collage by Danielle A. Scruggs/NPR)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: Businesses face uncertainty as Trump races to replace tariffs struck down by SCOTUS
item.description: The Trump administration is working quickly to impose new tariffs to replace the import taxes struck down by the Supreme Court. That's creating new uncertainty for businesses and trading partners.
item.content:encoded: The Trump administration is working quickly to impose new tariffs to replace the import taxes struck down by the Supreme Court. That's creating new uncertainty for businesses and trading partners.
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley
